New Records: Anrich Nortje took his career-best figures of 4 for 7
Ottneil Baartman bowled 20 dot balls in total, the joint-most by a bowler in an innings at a T20 World Cup, equalling Ajantha Mendis against Zimbabwe in 2012
Key Match Events: Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller took South Africa home with 22 balls to spare
Anrich Nortje finished with impeccable figures of 4 for 7
Ottneil Baartman struck with his first ball
Pre-Game Insights: The surface is tricky to bat on, there's inconsistent bounce, not much turn and the venue has big square boundaries, which are difficult to breach
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa won by 6 wickets (with 22 balls remaining)
The up-and-down surface meant the target of 78 was no walk in the park for South Africa, but they eventually got there in the 17th over
Miscellaneous Highlights: In all, 127 out of the 214 balls faced by the batters in this game were dots, the most dots in a Men's T20 World Cup game
